channel.description: Recent content in test on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Explorer NOUACCHECK Flag
item.description: Detects suspicious starts of explorer.exe that use the /NOUACCHECK flag that allows to run all sub processes of that newly started explorer.exe without any UAC checks

item.title: Delete Volume Shadow Copies via WMI with PowerShell

item.title: DNSCat2 Powershell Implementation Detection Via Process Creation
item.description: The PowerShell implementation of DNSCat2 calls nslookup to craft queries. Counting nslookup processes spawned by PowerShell will show hundreds or thousands of instances if PS DNSCat2 is active locally.

item.description: Detect run not allowed files. Applocker is a very useful tool, especially on servers where unprivileged users have access. For example terminal servers. You need configure applocker and log collect to receive these events.

item.title: Change Default File Association
item.description: When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.

item.title: Network Sniffing
item.description: Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection. An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

item.title: Masquerading as Linux Crond Process
item.description: Masquerading occurs when the name or location of an executable, legitimate or malicious, is manipulated or abused for the sake of evading defenses and observation. Several different variations of this technique have been observed.

item.title: Service Execution
item.description: Detects manual service execution (start) via system utilities.

item.title: Possible DNS Rebinding
item.description: Detects several different DNS-answers by one domain with IPs from internal and external networks. Normally, DNS-answer contain TTL >100. (DNS-record will saved in host cache for a while TTL).

item.title: Suspicious Outbound Kerberos Connection

item.description: Detects suspicious outbound network activity via kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.

item.title: Svchost DLL Search Order Hijack
item.description: IKEEXT and SessionEnv service, as they call LoadLibrary on files that do not exist within C:\Windows\System32\ by default. An attacker can place their malicious logic within the PROCESS_ATTACH block of their library and restart the aforementioned services “svchost.exe -k netsvcs” to gain code execution on a remote machine.

item.title: Disabling Windows Event Auditing
item.description: Detects scenarios where system auditing (ie: windows event log auditing) is disabled. This may be used in a scenario where an entity would want to bypass local logging to evade detection when windows event logging is enabled and reviewed. Also, it is recommended to turn off “Local Group Policy Object Processing” via GPO, which will make sure that Active Directory GPOs take precedence over local/edited computer policies via something such as “gpedit.msc”. Please note, that disabling “Local Group Policy Object Processing” may cause an issue in scenarios of one off specific GPO modifications – however it is recommended to perform these modifications in Active Directory anyways.

item.description: Detects persistence method using windows telemetry

item.title: Remote Code Execute via Winrm.vbs
item.description: Detects an attempt to execute code or create service on remote host via winrm.vbs.

item.description: Remote registry management using REG utility from non-admin workstation

item.description: Detects remote service activity via remote access to the svcctl named pipe

item.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

item.title: Remote WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers
item.description: Detect potential adversaries leveraging WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers remotely to move laterally in a network

item.title: Removal of Potential COM Hijacking Registry Keys
item.description: A General detection to trigger for processes removing .*\shell\open\command registry keys. Registry keys that might have been used for COM hijacking activities.

item.title: Renamed jusched.exe
item.description: Detects renamed jusched.exe used by cobalt group

item.title: Renamed Powershell Under Powershell Channel
item.description: Detects renamed powershell

item.title: Renamed SysInternals Debug View
item.description: Detects suspicious renamed SysInternals DebugView execution

item.title: REvil Kaseya Incident Malware Patterns
item.description: Detects process command line patterns and locations used by REvil group in Kaseya incident (can also match on other malware)

item.title: Run Once Task Configuration in Registry
item.description: Rule to detect the configuration of Run Once registry key. Configured payload can be run by runonce.exe /AlternateShellStartup

item.title: Run Once Task Execution as Configured in Registry
item.description: This rule detects the execution of Run Once task as configured in the registry

item.title: Run PowerShell Script from ADS
item.description: Detects PowerShell script execution from Alternate Data Stream (ADS)

item.title: Run PowerShell Script from Redirected Input Stream
item.description: Detects PowerShell script execution via input stream redirect

item.title: Ryuk Ransomware
item.description: Detects Ryuk Ransomware command lines

item.title: Scheduled Cron Task/Job
item.description: Detects abuse of the cron utility to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code. Detection will focus on crontab jobs uploaded from the tmp folder.

item.title: Scheduled Cron Task/Job
item.description: Detects abuse of the cron utility to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code. Detection will focus on crontab jobs uploaded from the tmp folder.

item.title: Screen Capture - macOS
item.description: Detects attempts to use screencapture to collect macOS screenshots

item.title: Sdclt Child Processes
item.description: A General detection for sdclt spawning new processes. This could be an indicator of sdclt being used for bypass UAC techniques.

item.title: Security Software Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities (only grep for now) to discover security software discovery

item.title: Security Software Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities (only grep for now) to discover security software discovery

item.title: Shadow Copies Access via Symlink
item.description: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities

item.title: Shadow Copies Creation Using Operating Systems Utilities
item.description: Shadow Copies creation using operating systems utilities, possible credential access

item.title: Silenttrinity Stager Msbuild Activity
item.description: Detects a possible remote connections to Silenttrinity c2

item.title: SMB Create Remote File Admin Share
item.description: Look for non-system accounts SMB accessing a file with write (0x2) access mask via administrative share (i.e C$).

item.title: Source Code Enumeration Detection by Keyword
item.description: Detects source code enumeration that use GET requests by keyword searches in URL strings

item.title: Split A File Into Pieces
item.description: Detection use of the command “split” to split files into parts and possible transfer.

item.title: Split A File Into Pieces
item.description: Detection use of the command “split” to split files into parts and possible transfer.

item.title: SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session Detection
item.description: This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqltoolsps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the Microsoft SQL Server Management studio. Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.

item.title: Startup Folder File Write
item.description: A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.

item.title: Startup Items
item.description: Detects creation of startup item plist files that automatically get executed at boot initialization to establish persistence.

item.title: StoneDrill Service Install
item.description: This method detects a service install of the malicious Microsoft Network Realtime Inspection Service service described in StoneDrill report by Kaspersky

item.title: Suspicious Access to Sensitive File Extensions - Zeek
item.description: Detects known sensitive file extensions via Zeek

item.title: Suspicious C2 Activities
item.description: Detects suspicious activities as declared by Florian Roth in its ‘Best Practice Auditd Configuration’. This includes the detection of the following commands; wget, curl, base64, nc, netcat, ncat, ssh, socat, wireshark, rawshark, rdesktop, nmap. These commands match a few techniques from the tactics “Command and Control”, including not exhaustively the following; Application Layer Protocol (T1071), Non-Application Layer Protocol (T1095), Data Encoding (T1132)

item.title: Suspicious Calculator Usage
item.description: Detects suspicious use of calc.exe with command line parameters or in a suspicious directory, which is likely caused by some PoC or detection evasion

item.title: Suspicious Copy From or To System32
item.description: Detects a suspicious copy command that copies a system program from System32 to another directory on disk - sometimes used to use LOLBINs like certutil or desktopimgdownldr to a different location with a different name

item.title: Suspicious Curl File Upload
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start the adds a file to a web request

item.title: Suspicious Curl Usage on Windows
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file

item.title: Suspicious Debugger Registration Cmdline
item.description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).

item.title: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet

item.title: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Target File
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr file creation that stores a file to a suspicious location or contains a file with a suspicious extension

item.title: Suspicious Driver Loaded By User
item.description: Detects the loading of drivers via ‘SeLoadDriverPrivilege’ required to load or unload a device driver. With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode. This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers. If you exclude privileged users/admins and processes, which are allowed to do so, you are maybe left with bad programs trying to load malicious kernel drivers. This will detect Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs) and the usage of Sysinternals and various other tools. So you have to work with a whitelist to find the bad stuff.

item.title: Suspicious Eventlog Clear or Configuration Using Wevtutil
item.description: Detects clearing or configuration of eventlogs using wevtutil, powershell and wmic. Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others).

item.title: Suspicious Execution from Outlook
item.description: Detects EnableUnsafeClientMailRules used for Script Execution from Outlook

item.title: Suspicious ftp.exe
item.description: Detects renamed ftp.exe, ftp.exe script execution and child processes ran by ftp.exe

item.title: Suspicious GUP Usage
item.description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater in a suspicious directory, which is often used in DLL side-loading attacks

item.title: Suspicious History File Operations
item.description: Detects commandline operations on shell history files

item.title: Suspicious History File Operations
item.description: Detects commandline operations on shell history files

item.title: Suspicious Multiple File Rename Or Delete Occurred
item.description: Detects multiple file rename or delete events occurrence within a specified period of time by a same user (these events may signalize about ransomware activity).

item.title: Suspicious Parent of Csc.exe
item.description: Detects a suspicious parent of csc.exe, which could by a sign of payload delivery

item.title: Suspicious PFX File Creation
item.description: A general detection for processes creating PFX files. This could be an indicator of an adversary exporting a local certificate to a PFX file.

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Cmdline
item.description: Detects the PowerShell command lines with reversed strings

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Command Line
item.description: Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters

item.title: Suspicious Printer Driver Empty Manufacturer
item.description: Detects a suspicious printer driver installation with an empty Manufacturer value

item.title: Suspicious PrinterPorts Creation (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects new commands that add new printer port which point to suspicious file

item.title: Suspicious PROCEXP152.sys File Created In TMP
item.description: Detects the creation of the PROCEXP152.sys file in the application-data local temporary folder. This driver is used by Sysinternals Process Explorer but also by KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU) or Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU.

item.title: Suspicious PsExec Execution
item.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

item.title: Suspicious PsExec Execution - Zeek
item.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

item.title: Suspicious Reverse Shell Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands or program code that may be executed or used in command line to establish a reverse shell

item.title: Suspicious Run Key from Download
item.description: Detects the suspicious RUN keys created by software located in Download or temporary Outlook/Internet Explorer directories

item.title: Suspicious Rundll32 Setupapi.dll Activity
item.description: setupapi.dll library provide InstallHinfSection function for processing INF files. INF file may contain instructions allowing to create values in the registry, modify files and install drivers. This technique could be used to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys, run process or use other DLLs chain calls (see references) InstallHinfSection function in setupapi.dll calls runonce.exe executable regardless of actual content of INF file.

item.title: Suspicious Runscripthelper.exe
item.description: Detects execution of powershell scripts via Runscripthelper.exe

item.title: Suspicious Service DACL Modification
item.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications that can be used to hide services or make them unstopable

item.title: Suspicious Service Installed
item.description: Detects installation of NalDrv or PROCEXP152 services via registry-keys to non-system32 folders. Both services are used in the tool Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU)

item.title: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console
item.description: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell

item.title: Suspicious VBoxDrvInst.exe Parameters
item.description: Detect VBoxDrvInst.exe run with parameters allowing processing INF file. This allows to create values in the registry and install drivers. For example one could use this technique to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys

item.title: Suspicious VSFTPD Error Messages
item.description: Detects suspicious VSFTPD error messages that indicate a fatal or suspicious error that could be caused by exploiting attempts

item.title: Suspicious WebDav Client Execution
item.description: A General detection for svchost.exe spawning rundll32.exe with command arguments like C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie. This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on WebDav Server).

item.title: Symlink Etc Passwd
item.description: Detects suspicious command lines that look as if they would create symbolic links to /etc/passwd

item.title: Sysinternals SDelete File Deletion
item.description: A General detection to trigger for the deletion of files by Sysinternals SDelete. It looks for the common name pattern used to rename files.

item.title: Sysmon Channel Reference Deletion
item.description: Potential threat actor tampering with Sysmon manifest and eventually disabling it

item.title: System Network Connections Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover system network connections

item.title: System Network Connections Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover system network connections

item.title: System Network Discovery - Linux
item.description: Detects enumeration of local network configuration

item.title: System Network Discovery - macOS
item.description: Detects enumeration of local network configuration

item.title: System Shutdown/Reboot
item.description: Adversaries may shutdown/reboot systems to interrupt access to, or aid in the destruction of, those systems.

item.title: System Shutdown/Reboot
item.description: Adversaries may shutdown/reboot systems to interrupt access to, or aid in the destruction of, those systems.

item.title: T1021 DCOM InternetExplorer.Application Iertutil DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named iertutil.dll in the C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\ directory over the network for a DCOM InternetExplorer DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: T1047 Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named wbemcomn.dll in the C:\Windows\System32\wbem\ directory over the network for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: T1086 PowerShell Execution
item.description: Detects execution of PowerShell

item.title: TA505 Dropper Load Pattern
item.description: Detects mshta loaded by wmiprvse as parent as used by TA505 malicious documents

item.title: TAIDOOR RAT DLL Load
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Chinese TAIDOOR RAT malware load

item.title: Telegram API Access
item.description: Detects suspicious requests to Telegram API without the usual Telegram User-Agent

item.title: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares
item.description: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

item.title: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares - Zeek
item.description: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

item.title: Turla ComRAT
item.description: Detects Turla ComRAT patterns

item.title: Turla Group Commands May 2020
item.description: Detects commands used by Turla group as reported by ESET in May 2020

item.title: Turla Group Named Pipes
item.description: Detects a named pipe used by Turla group samples

item.title: UAC Bypass Via Wsreset
item.description: Unfixed method for UAC bypass from windows 10. WSReset.exe file associated with the Windows Store. It will run a binary file contained in a low-privilege registry.

item.title: Unauthorized System Time Modification
item.description: Detect scenarios where a potentially unauthorized application or user is modifying the system time.

item.title: Unsigned Image Loaded Into LSASS Process
item.description: Loading unsigned image (DLL, EXE) into LSASS process

item.title: USB Device Plugged
item.description: Detects plugged USB devices

item.title: Using SettingSyncHost.exe as LOLBin
item.description: Detects using SettingSyncHost.exe to run hijacked binary

item.title: Verclsid.exe Runs COM Object
item.description: Detects when verclsid.exe is used to run COM object via GUID

item.title: Visual Basic Command Line Compiler Usage
item.description: Detects successful code compilation via Visual Basic Command Line Compiler that utilizes Windows Resource to Object Converter.

item.title: Wdigest CredGuard Registry Modification
item.description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of IsCredGuardEnabled from HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest to disable Cred Guard on a system. This is usually used with UseLogonCredential to manipulate the caching credentials.

item.title: Weak Encryption Enabled and Kerberoast
item.description: Detects scenario where weak encryption is enabled for a user profile which could be used for hash/password cracking.

item.title: WebDav Put Request
item.description: A General detection for WebDav user-agent being used to PUT files on a WebDav network share. This could be an indicator of exfiltration.

item.title: Windows Network Access Suspicious desktop.ini Action
item.description: Detects unusual processes accessing desktop.ini remotely over network share, which can be leveraged to alter how Explorer displays a folder’s content (i.e. renaming files) without changing them on disk.

item.title: Winnti Malware HK University Campaign
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Winnti malware noticed in Dec/Jan 2020 in a campaign against Honk Kong universities

item.title: Winword.exe Loads Suspicious DLL
item.description: Detects Winword.exe loading of custmom dll via /l cmd switch

item.title: WMI Persistence - Command Line Event Consumer
item.description: Detects WMI command line event consumers

item.title: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer File Write
item.description: Detects file writes of WMI script event consumer

item.title: WMI Script Host Process Image Loaded
item.description: Detects signs of the WMI script host process %SystemRoot%\system32\wbem\scrcons.exe functionality being used via images being loaded by a process.

item.title: WMIC Loading Scripting Libraries
item.description: Detects threat actors proxy executing code and bypassing application controls by leveraging wmic and the /FORMAT argument switch to download and execute an XSL file (i.e js, vbs, etc).

item.title: WMIExec VBS Script
item.description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript

item.title: WSL Execution
item.description: Detects Possible usage of Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) binary as a LOLBIN

item.title: Wuauclt Network Connection
item.description: Detects the use of the Windows Update Client binary (wuauclt.exe) to proxy execute code and making a network connections. One could easily make the DLL spawn a new process and inject to it to proxy the network connection and bypass this rule.
